column4: In KDE there's a very intuitive mail-envolope that's clearly labeled as KMail and seamlessly integrates with my Live Mail account..
I log-in to KDE and the mail-envolope shakes, showing a little "1" and a "+" to indicate I have 1 unread new mail..
I can click it and get my mail... Ubuntu Unity, though? Nope!

It's some totaly unituitive mail-envolope that does NOT change when I have a new mail, it does NOT integrate at all with my mail it's just a stupid link to Thunderbird haha why not I just open Thunderbird from the Launcher menu??
It isn't even labeled, I don't even know what program is behind this mail-envolope on Ubuntu 12.04 Unity.
It's not a problem with KDE, like I just said.. KDE works perfectly fine in that regard and makes perfect sense. It's Ubuntu's UNITY that does not make any sense LOL.
I'll see what I can't figure out on my own ffs.
Seriously, KDE is not the problem...
You're missing what I'm saying, or something. Just don't worry about it :P
what is the exact issue. keep it all on ONE line
lets take the chit chat elsewhere
Yea, heaven forbid we talk about Flash not being available for Linux in an Ubuntu channel, right?
it is available. stay on topic
